fields.description:
PFB the steps for replicate the issue
1)Create a new WO.
2)select any date & location in 1st page "Date & Location" pill.
3)Fill the details in "Service Info" page and click on "Next" button.
4)Page is redirected to "Vendor Details" tab. Click on "Next" button. 
5)Page is redirected to "Conflicts" tab.
6)Click on any cell and cell is marked as blue.
7)On the top right pane "WEDNESDAY 09/13 - #BA-DANVILLE, CA" instead of "WEDNESDAY 09/13 - #021"
8)PFA the screenshot for the expected behavior(As per NES-875) and the current status
9)NES-830 is also affected by this bug as it is related to NES-875

fields.description:
Create unit tests against some of the service and util classes that will serve as patterns for the team to develop further unit tests. These tests must demonstrate 

- Validating responses provided by the service and util classes in case of methods that are meant to return a value
- Validating effects to the system (via mocks) in case of methods which are intended to update/delete/create records
- Validating exceptional scenarios by verifying the errors thrown. This must only handle errors that are handled by the code
- Mocking dependencies
- Achieving the necessary code coverage (> 90%) including line as well as branch coverage
- Creating any frameworks/common classes if necessary
fields.summary: Create sample unit tests against current code

fields.description:
Background
For the purposes of the Item Management deliverable and demo to the business, we need to build the basics for Billing Assignments even if we only have a single Vendor for now and no option for adding another Vendor, such as Costco, to share in the payment for the WO.  See the screenshots for Manage Billing Assignments for Combos and Splits to see the design (attached below).

Note: We're only supporting single vendor at this time but must design with multiple vendors in mind so that significant re-work is avoided.

Note: Cost estimation needs to take Billing Assignments into cost estimation per vendor once this work is completed.
fields.summary: Manage Billing Assignments
DB Schema: Define missing tables
API: Auto-generate code based on new entities introduced
Client App: GET billing assignments related to WO
Client App: Render Billing Assignments table
Client App: Render Billing Assignments on Summary screen
Client app: Include Billing Assignments when saving/scheduling WO
API: Validate and save Billing Assignments when saving WO
Test case design
Test execution

fields.description:
When the Scheduler clicks on the 'SEND A VENDOR A PREPAID FORM' link in Step 3 of the WO Wizard (Vendor Details), an email should
# Email
## Open up an email addressed to the following
### Vendor Scheduling Contact(s)
### Regional Scheduling Office
### AR Dept
## Subject = 'Prepaid Invoice for CDS' (will vary by BU)
## From = User logged in when the 'SEND A VENDOR A PREPAID FORM' link is clicked
## Email Body = 
# Attachment
## The Prepaid Invoice form should be attached to the email (see attached form below)
## The form should be filled out with the data from the Work Order including:
### Bill To = Vendor Scheduling Contact(s)
### Attn = 
### Invoice = 
### Date = 
### Amount = Cost Estimate for the Work Order
# Editing
## The User should be allowed to edit the Email Body
## The User should be allowed to open and edit the attached Prepaid Form
# Sending
## Once the User has made whatever edits they feel are necessary, they should be able to send the email
## Email should be sent through our email application for delivery and tracking purposes.

fields.description:
Acceptance Criteria
# When I select a Work Order from the Work Order queue, the overview panel should display an edit button with the following label, depending on the Work Order queue tab selected:
## "Schedule Work Order" from the Not Ready overview tab
## "Edit/View Work Order" from the Scheduled overview tab 
## "View Work Order" from the Completed overview tab
# When viewing a work order, its title should appear as follows:
## New Work Order (#123) for a new work order 
## Edit Work Order (#123) for an existing work order
# When viewing a work order, I should be taken to the first step in the WO
# Vendor Contacts need to be populated
# For Step 1
## Distinct dates need to be selected in the multi-date picker
### We need to display the month corresponding to the first date in the work order
## Distinct dates are to be displayed as date pills
### The first date pill should be auto selected
## Locations for the date pill selected are to be checked
### The first region (alphabetically) for the locations checked should be selected
### The region location count badges should display correct counts
# For Step 2
## Bind all simple attributes of Work Order
## DPIS ( Need to integrate later )
## Add-on Services
## Regional Focus
## Billing Assignments ( Need to integrate later )
# For Step 5 ( Dependency on NES-1856)
## Text entry fields that exist there 

Technical Notes
* Bind fields not currently bound accurately

fields.description:
Assumptions
# The work for this story assumes that NES-430 's data grid view has been completed as it relies on the view for its functionality
# Only the scheduling team interacts with this view
# The side panel work is covered in NES-874
# This work is only done from the desktop, not the tablet 

Acceptance Criteria
# After selecting to move all locations or all conflicts on a date NES-874, the date headers in the table view become blue and selectable, also the side panel updates (described below)
## The conflicts that are normally links to the date-location conflict detail become read-only text (not links) during the moving process.
## When a date is selected, the conflict information if this event was moved to the selected date and location appears. This is similar to the conflict details in NES-874 except as described below:
### <Cancel moving event> button
#### Cancels the move date workflow, leaving the originally selected cell selected
### When a new date is selected:
#### A conflicts message (or a no conflicts message) appears dependent on whether or not there are item (another item with same service tag) , department (items within same department exceed threshold), or workforce capacity conflicts (sales advisors required exceeds threshold) that would be created or worsened by moving the selected event to the selected date.
#### <Confirm new date> button
##### Moves the all events or conflicts to the selected date, ends the move date workflow and selects the column of the newly scheduled date

fields.description:
Assumptions
# This view is limited to the scheduler role
# The item DPIS is contained in a modal
# Access to DPIS modal is determined in NES-864
# The data for UAT is going to be manually loaded into the backend, and provided by Daymon business
# This story covers the read-only state of the modal, editing the DPIS is covered by NES-883

Acceptance Criteria
# Title: {name of instructions selected from dropdown in NES-864} DPIS (EX: "Master DPIS")
## We will read the values from the item DPIS for the following fields
### Vendor name
### Item name
### Item number
### Department
### KS Item
### Item Delivery (only for the Food field, the other item delivery will be have their values left blank)
### Details
### Sell unit
### Count
### Samples per sell unit
### Serving size
### Yield per hour
### Purchase limit
### Supply charge
### Supply type
### Method of cooking
### Service tags
### Enhancements
### Allergens
### Peanut allergy sign
### Region-specific variations
## Preparation instructions
## Selling points
## -Survey questions-
## -Item photos-
### File name
#### Format: filename.doctype
#### When clicked, display document in new tab
#### If document cannot be displayed in browser, initiate download
### Timestamp
#### Time and date, format: {12 hour time - MM/DD/YY}
### Delete icon
#### When clicked, displays remove confirmation modal
#### Remove confirmation modal
##### Title: Remove attachment
##### Message: Are you sure you would like to remove {name of attachment} from this work order?
## -Demo files-
### Same format as item photos above
## Right column
### Title: Manage this DPIS
### Section title: "Create a unique DPIS for this work order"
### Description: "Changes to this DPIS apply to ONLY the current work order. This will NOT update the Master DPIS."
### <Edit this DPIS> button
#### Switches to the "edit" state of the DPIS modal (NES-883)
### Section title: "Edit the regional DPIS"
### Description: "If you need to update the regional DPIS for this item, please contact the DPIS team."
### <Contact the DPIS team> button
#### As per NES-376
### Section title: "Edit the master DPIS"
### Description: "If you need to update the master DPIS for this item, please contact the DPIS team."
### <Contact the DPIS team> button
#### As per NES-376

Please Note:
* Prep instructions and selling points will be provided as a single item of text -- we'll need to detect line breaks and prepend numbers to form an ordered list as per comp.

fields.description:
Assumptions
# This view is limited to the scheduler role
# The item DPIS is contained in a modal
# Access to DPIS modal is determined in NES-864. Only display details for the DPIS selected in that step.
# The data for UAT is going to be manually loaded into the backend, and provided by Daymon business.
# This story covers the edit state of the modal, the read-only view of the DPIS is covered by NES-872


Acceptance Criteria
# Title: {name of instructions selected from dropdown in NES-864 } DPIS (EX: "Master DPIS")
## Vendor name
### Name of the vendor who is the Costco supplier of the item
### This field is not editable
## Item name
### This field is not editable
## Item number
### This field is not editable
## <Department> dropdown
### This field is not editable
## <Kirkland signature> radio group
### This field is not editable
## Item Delivery
### Sub sections (show only the line of business selected in NES-853)
#### Food
#### Roadshow
#### Vendor performed
#### Vendor assisted demo
#### Vendor assisted roadshow
### Dropdown options
#### Purchase
#### Do not purchase
#### Does not apply
## Details
### <Sell unit> text entry
#### Disabled
### <Count> text entry
#### Disabled
### <Samples per sell unit> text entry
#### Open text field
### <Serving size> text entry
#### Open text field
### <Yield per hour> text entry
#### Open text field
### <Purchase limit> text entry
#### Open text field
### <Supply charge> radio group
#### Yes
#### No
### <Supply type> multi-select dropdown
#### Provided in enumerations document
### <Method of cooking> dropdown
#### Provided in enumerations document
### <Service tags>
#### There are 74 service tags listed here: https://drive.google.com/file/d/0Bx4SHo5WGqlwMnpzbVJOX1VPVVU/view
### <Enhancements> dropdown
#### Enhancement Options
##### Bread
##### Chips
##### Cheese
##### Butter
##### Jelly/Jam
##### Crackers
##### Salsa
##### Sour cream
##### Cream Cheese
##### Guacamole
##### Olive Oil
##### Salad Mix
##### Meatballs
##### Pasta
##### Bottled Water
### <Allergens> Multi-select dropdown
#### Disabled
#### Display selections comma-separated
### <Peanut allergy sign> radio group
#### Disabled
#### Yes
#### No
## Preparation instructions
### Style Bar
#### Bold
#### Italic
#### Underlined
#### Numbered List (This should always be on)
### Should be a numbered list text box
## Selling points
### Style Bar
#### Bold
#### Italic
#### Underlined
#### Numbered List (This should always be on)
### Should be a numbered list text box
## Right column
### Title: Manage this DPIS
### Section title: "Create a unique DPIS for this work order"
### Description: "Changes to this DPIS apply to ONLY the current Work Order. This will NOT update the Master DPIS."
### <Save changes> button
#### Switches to the "View" state of the DPIS modal (NES-872)

Technical Notes:
# Generalize implementation of Service Tags for use elsewhere in the application.

Subtasks Effort
* Service Tag component: 1 day
* Remainder: 2 days

fields.description:
anAssumptions
# This view is limited to the scheduler role
# Each region selected for the work order (see NES-868) has it's own section
# Selections in these fields cannot be made until an item has been selected (see NES-863)

Acceptance Criteria
# Section title: Item instructions
# Repeat the following for each regions selected
## Region name
## <View/Customize> Button
### When clicked, opens modal for the DPIS NES-872 selected in the dropdown below
## <Select DPIS> dropdown options
### The default value for the dropdown is the region-specific DPIS for each displayed region. If there is no region-specific DPIS, it defaults to the Master DPIS
### Master DPIS
#### The master DPIS for the item selected
### Regional DPIS(s)
#### If one or more regional DPISs have already been created for the selected item, display them in the dropdown (the user may select another region's DPIS)
#### Regional DPISs are displayed by region name in ascending alphabetical order, starting after the Master DPIS
### Custom DPIS(s)
#### If one or more custom DPISs have been created for the item in previous work orders, display them in the dropdown
#### Custom DPISs are displayed in ascending alphabetical order, starting after the last regional DPIS

Technical Notes
# List of DPISs should be fetched upon selection of an item in the work order. DPIS details (field values) should be included in response; we should not have to make an additional network request.
# We need to observe changes to the item selected on the work order, as well as the list of regions of the work order events.

Subtask Estimates
* Backend web service, and unit tests: 3d
* Update diagram: 2h
* Front-end entity service: 2d
* UI template: 2d

issuetype.name: Story

status.description: This status is managed internally by JIRA Software
status.name: Ready For Test

fields.description:
Assumptions
# Conflict limits for capacity, department, and item conflicts are provided by the business in a separate file provided here: https://drive.google.com/open?id=16w0IyHos7rx_NHcRtE-kaN0NxfgpcIXJzumKYRAQY44

Acceptance Criteria
# Identical to NES-430 except as noted below:
## If there are any events in the work order with workforce capacity conflicts the next button is disabled
# Dates need to display year (current format is MM/DD -> MM/DD/YY)
# Cells with an event scheduled to run on that date-location should be highlighted light blue
# Dates with retailer holidays should be grayed out/disabled
# While scrolling down the Date section of the data table and everything above that should be static.

Technical Notes
# UI
## Populate dates from Step 1
## Clicking on a date scrolls the grid so that the selected date appears within the first week
## Based on selected items in the work order, provide a list of departments to be displayed in the grid
## Based on selected locations in the work order, provide a list of locations to be displayed in the grid
## Highlight cells (in light blue) for events that have been selected in the work order
## Limit region filter to regions selected in work order
## When modeling, consider splitting backend data (essentially capacities) for date range, and work order data on the front-end
## Graph has 2 numbers
### Average of the total capacity for all locations (rows) in the grid  currently done in the front-end
### Average number of events per location  Note: number of events per location is not displayed in the location rows
## Validation  workforce capacity limits must be respected
# Backend
## Implement endpoint that returns currently scheduled aggregated data for
### these locations, departments, dates and item attributes
### consider loading 2 weeks ahead of intended view, also
## add Location total capacity, food, and non-food, and department attributes
## (FUTURE WORK) Modify User account, for schedulers, a region of responsibility is to be included
# Follow-up Discussion Topics
## as the user considers moving event(s) from one date to another, we probably should update the counts in the UI by performing arithmetic on the front-end, without hitting the backend

fields.description:
This component is added to the side panel for the conflict resolution view. It shows an overview of any dates with conflicts on them.

Assumptions
# Each conflict type is described in NES-874 or NES-870
# Conflicts must exist (and this story's links must be completed) before this work can be completed

Acceptance Criteria
# Panel title: Conflicts overview
# A conflict count is displayed below the title.
## If no conflicts exist a "No conflicts to display" message is shown.
# Conflicts by date are displayed below the conflict count
## Date is displayed in MM/DD/YY format.
### Dates without conflicts are not shown
### Clicking on the date opens the date conflicts panel NES-874
## Workforce capacity count is shown first "# workforce capacity conflicts"
### This text is hidden if no workforce capacity conflicts exist
## Department conflict count is shown first "# department conflicts"
### This text is hidden if no department conflicts exist
## Item conflict count is shown first "# item conflicts"
### This text is hidden if no item conflicts exist

fields.description:
Assumptions
# The work in this story is dependent on the completion of the table view NES-430
# The limits described below will be provided to us for UAT by Daymon but in the future will be configured by the system at the business unit level (for a default) and region level and is customized at the location level.
# The move events button is part of the effort for this story, but the workflow for moving the event is covered in NES-830

Acceptance Criteria
# Users can click on a cell on the table (each cell represents the conflict information for a single location on a single date  in the mock up it's the conflict information for warehouse 1294 on 12/16)
## When selected, the cell becomes blue and the panel on the right updates with date/location specific conflict details
### Side panel title: "Date  Location #"
### Event breakdown  Events are broken down by food and non-food departments.
### Food
#### To the right of the food header, a total count of food events scheduled on that day is displayed compared to the event capacity assigned to food
##### This is a soft limit
##### If the scheduled events exceed the capacity, the numbers will display red 
#### The following department numbers are "Food" departments: 11 to 19, 61 to 65, and 88
##### To the right of each department name, a count of events being run with items from that department are shown
###### If the number exceeds the maximum amount of same-department events allowed, the number will display red
### Non-food
#### To the right of the non-food header, a total count of non-food events scheduled on that day is displayed compared to the event capacity assigned to non-food
##### This is a soft limit
##### If the scheduled events exceed the capacity, the numbers will display red 
#### All other departments not listed above as "Food" are considered "Non-food"
##### To the right of each department name, a count of events being run with items from that department are shown
###### If the number exceeds the maximum amount of same-department events allowed, the number will display red
### Move event
#### Clicking on this button begins the move single date workflow described in NES-830
#### If the selected cell does not have an event from the work order then the 'Move Event' button (described above) should be disabled.

fields.description:
Assumptions
# The work for this story assumes that NES-430 's data grid view has been completed as it relies on the view for its functionality
# Only the scheduling team interacts with this view
# The side panel work is covered in NES-874
# This work is only done from the desktop, not the tablet 

Acceptance Criteria
# After selecting to move all locations or all conflicts on a date NES-874, the date headers in the table view become blue and selectable, also the side panel updates (described below)
## The conflicts that are normally links to the date-location conflict detail become read-only text (not links) during the moving process.
## When a date is selected, the conflict information if this event was moved to the selected date and location appears. This is similar to the conflict details in NES-874 except as described below:
### <Cancel moving event> button
#### Cancels the move date workflow, leaving the originally selected cell selected
### When a new date is selected:
#### A conflicts message (or a no conflicts message) appears dependent on whether or not there are item (another item with same service tag) , department (items within same department exceed threshold), or workforce capacity conflicts (sales advisors required exceeds threshold) that would be created or worsened by moving the selected event to the selected date.
#### <Confirm new date> button
##### Moves the all events or conflicts to the selected date, ends the move date workflow and selects the column of the newly scheduled date

#### A conflicts message (or a no conflicts message) appears dependent on whether or not there are item (another item with same service tag) , department (items within same department exceed threshold), or workforce capacity conflicts (sales advisors required exceeds threshold) that would be created or worsened by moving the selected event to the selected date.
#### <Confirm new date> button
##### Moves the event to the selected date, ends the move date workflow and selects the cell of the newly moved event

fields.description:
Acceptance Criteria
# When the user clicks on a date in the header of the conflicts table, the entire column is selected
## Selecting the column updates the panel on the right to show conflict information for the selected date in all locations show in the table
### The panel header is the selected day and date (ex. Sunday 12/16)
### Overall conflict count
#### Display the message: "x(number of conflicts) of y (total events on this date) events in conflict on this date."
#### If there are no conflicts display the message "No conflicts on this date." in green.
### Workforce capacity conflicts
#### Display a list of locations that have a number of sales advisors required over the maximum determined by the business
#### Clicking on a warehouse number opens the individual location-date NES-875
### Department conflicts
#### Displays a count of department conflicts by warehouse
#### Clicking on a warehouse number or the "view" link opens the individual location-date NES-875
### Item conflicts
#### Displays a count of item conflicts as the header for the section
#### Below is a list of item conflicts, by location on the select date
##### Item conflicts are created when a scheduled item has a service tag that matches a service tag belonging to the item we are scheduling.
##### Displays: Warehouse location #, Item #, Vendor name, Item description, and any service tags of items currently scheduled that will create an item conflict with the item being scheduled
##### Clicking on a warehouse number opens the individual location-date NES-875
### Move all events
#### When clicked begins the NES-640 workflow
### Move conflicts

PFB the steps to replicate:

2)select any date & location in 1st page "Date & Location" pill.
3)Fill the details in "Service Info" page and click on "Next" button.

10)Come back to the previous date which contained conflicts  and found the same "There will be 3 of 4 events in conflict if moved to this date." is also displayed there

fields.description:
# The user needs to view the total cost estimate for a work order in the queue when selecting the work order. This only applies to the Not Ready and Scheduled tabs. 
# [Here is the comp for a selected WO in the Not Ready tab of the queue|https://daymon.atlassian.net/wiki/display/NES/Scheduling+Work+Queue?preview=/12648464/21856293/02%20-%20Work%20Queue%20-%20Not%20Ready%20-%20Selected.png]
# [Here is the comp for a selected WO in the Not Ready tab of the queue|https://daymon.atlassian.net/wiki/display/NES/Scheduling+Work+Queue?preview=/12648464/21758060/07%20-%20Work%20Queue%20-%20Scheduled%20-%20Selected.png]
# Note that the label for both of these pie charts should read Total spend (even though we're displaying an estimate)
# For a work order displayed in Complete tab of the work order queue we will display the actual spend, in the future

Technical notes
* We will need to persist the total cost estimate of a work order alongside the work order
* In future work (captured in NES-1327), these cost estimates will be kept up to date following ancillary costs (avg. sample cost, etc.) changes retrieved from the DWH

fields.summary: After Scheduling total estimated cost are not displayed in the right pane

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
* As we persist the total cost estimate for a work order when the user saves it, the estimate may become stale over time. As such, the aim of this story is to update the Total Cost Estimate of WOs with "Not Ready" status (TBD: confirm WOs with "Scheduled" don't need to be updated).
* Updates are to occur on a batched basis when data is retrieved from the DWH. WO cost is a byproduct of the user selections (events, hours, etc.) as well as historical input costs coming from the DWH such as avg. sample cost, etc. We already update the total cost estimate when the user's selections change (see NES-1326), this story deals with the latter case.

# This view is limited to the scheduler role

# Attached materials

#### Message: "Are you sure you would like to remove {name of attachment} from this work order?
#### Cancel and Remove Attachment buttons
# File input drop zone
## Title: Drag your files here
## Link: Or click here to browse
### When clicked, open native file system browser

Technical Notes
* Upload of files occurs upon save (when exiting or scheduling)

fields.description:
Assumptions
# This view is limited to the scheduler role
# The user arrives at this screen by clicking on the next button on step 2 (date and location selection)(NES-866)
# This view is the one implemented in NES-372

Acceptance Criteria
# Credit overview
## Credit limit will be loaded from the DB until it is available from the JDE 
## Remaining will be a calculation of Credit Limit - Pending Due
## Pending due is the amount pending from existing not invoiced orders.  We can use the Cost Estimate of each uninvoiced WO until the data for invoices is available fro JDE
# Status
## Will be loaded from the DB until it is available from JDE

Technical Notes
# Utilize saved WO cost estimations ([~aselvaraj] is this work done already?)
# Every time a WO is saved, aggregate cost estimations relating to that vendor and update that vendor's pending amount.
## Add AmountPendingDue column to Client table.
# Trigger this logic every time a work order is saved through Work Order Scheduler endpoint

Known Caveats
# We're ignoring JDE integration (invoiced, etc.)
# There will be no cost estimates associated with WO not created using the application (e.g. seeder)

fields.description:
When the Scheduler clicks on the 'SEND ORDER TO ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE' link in Step 3 of the WO Wizard (Vendor Details), an email should
# Email
## Open up an email addressed to the following
### AR Dept
## Subject = 'Inquiry related to WO# (insert Request#)'
## From = User logged in when the 'SEND ORDER TO ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE' link is clicked
## Email Body = 'Vendor will be $#####.## over their  Credit Limit if WO# is scheduled.  Can we extend them additional Credit or send them a Prepaid Invoice for the Balance?' 
### Vendor = Vendor selected in the WO
### $#####.## = the amount the WO will exceed their Credit Limit (Cost Estimation - Remaining Credit)
### WO# = the Request# in NES
# Editing
## The User should be allowed to edit the Email Body
# Sending
## Once the User has made whatever edits they feel are necessary, they should be able to send the email
## Email should be sent through our email application for delivery and tracking purposes.

fields.description: There seem to be some issues with the SQL query. An event is a single event that has a location and a date. For each date in a work order, the number of locations for that date is the number of events for that date. The sum of events for all dates in a work order is the total events for the work order and that is what we should be displaying. Right now, it looks like we are trying to multiply dates by locations, or something similar, which is not correct.

fields.description:
Background
* The api controllers are broken down into ones auto-generated based on the db entities, as well as custom ones.
* Currently, we auto-generate swagger files to describe the expected inputs/output -- ie. request and response objects. However, we don't define DTOs as of yet.
* This task is to POC a GraphQL approach that can be used to auto-generated these definitions and a mechanism to leverage them in the client app.
* We have another task that covers validation of inputs currently (NES-2014).

fields.description:
Performance slow on work order creation region change

# Create a work order
# On Step 1 choose a date
# Change to Texas region
# Notice how long the locations take to load
# Change to midest
# Notice how long the locations take to load
We need to find a way to speed this up. These should be immediate

*Technical Notes:*
This issue exists because of the response time coming from the API.  As the user clicks on the region the locations are retrieved from the database.  This is highly inefficient, would recommend creating an API that would deliver a RegionModel with an array of locations that are tied to each region for better UI performance.

fields.description:
h2. Create Script to Export Dimension Data

h3. Application Requirements
* Written in Python
* Able to be scheduled for multiple, sometimes parallel execution times
* Able to be executed from AWS Lambda
* Should have an API for interacting with services / features
* Should write to an execution log for tracking success / failure
* Should send notifications of success / failure via email to a configurable set of recipients

h3. Data Transformation Requirements
* Join multiple table results in a rowset
* Cardinality of columns is an important factor
* Key structure used:
** PK1, PK2, PK3, PK4, TimeStamp (Collectively oldest), Columns, + New Columns (always at end)
* Pipe-Delimited, Double-Quoted
* Preserve data types across requests
* Timestamp as UTC-formatted date: 2017-08-15T13:45:00Z-7
* Available Data Types:
** BigInt
** VarChar
** TimeStamp
** Boolean
** Float (17,17)
* Virtual Deletes

issuetype.name: Story

fields.description:
Assumptions
# The modal in NES-371 needs to take any entered text and pass it on as part of an API call that will email the Account Receivable team's group account (to be provided).
# The following information will need to be broken down by region for the vendor(s) if the vendor is split by region in JDE
# The email portion of this story relies on the research in NES-1307
# The cost breakdown portion of this story relies on the implementation of NES-1141

Note:
* AR stands for accounts receivable.
* Troubleshooting of email issues on Daymon's environments is out of scope for this story

Acceptance Criteria
# In addition to the text entered by the user in NES-371, we also need to include:
## Vendor name
## Regions for the events scheduled in the work order
## Estimated cost (for the work order) broken down by month for the months the work order spans
## (FUTURE WORK) Estimated outstanding amount broken down by month for the months the work order spans
## (FUTURE WORK) JDE information
### Vendor(s) credit limit
### Vendor(s) amount due
### Vendors aging report (30, 60, 90, balances)
# When the modal is dismissed (using X, clicking outside of modal, or Send button), the text area should be cleared.

Notes
* For the time being, consider only a single vendor, until we implement combo/split functionality to be detailed in the future
* Currently this story is absent an email template, so developers will use their own discretion (layout the content linearly -- use plain text and segment using line-breaks)

Follow-up
* What email address do we send this request to in Production?
* What email address do we send this request to in TEST?
* We need credentials for an email account to send from. [~SShliakhtsitsau]
* What should be the subject of the email? [~scornell]

Down the line
* Include JDE data -- see related NES-1445

Technical Notes
* Modal text input to be included in body, in addition to criteria described above
* Email addresses should be configured in a file. Use the following keys:
** accountsReceivableEmailAddress
** generalPurposeEmailAddressUsername
** generalPurposeEmailAddressPassword
** generalPurposeEmailAddressServer
** etc.

fields.description:
When a work order is scheduled, the system must send an email to the associated vendor(s).

Acceptance Criteria
# The following data must be included in the system generated email:
## Date requested: (MM/DD/YY) ex. 5/15/17
## Company: (Daymon business unit) ex. Club Demonstration Services
## Region: (Retailer region) ex. Northwest
## Contact name: (Full name of the user who requested the work order) ex. Katrina Frank
## Contact phone: (Phone number of the requesting user) ex. 425-462-0075
## Contact email: (Email of the requesting user) ex. kfrank@gmail.com
## Vendor specific information follows (broken down by vendor). This section will repeat for each vendor associated with the work order
### Vendor name: 
### PO #:
### Item number:
### Item description:
### Item delivery: Item delivery for Work Order line of business
### Enhancements:
### -Demo kit included-: FUTURE WORK
### Billing assignment:
### Billing notes:
## Two for one stores: 
## Dates (MM/DD/YY) for each date in the work order
### Location list for each date, comma separated
## Memo notes:
## Confirmation notes:
## Regional focus:
## Thank you, <Company Name -- e.g. Club Demonstration Services>

Update AC to include:
# Who to send to?
## Vendor's Scheduling Contacts for each region specified in the work order.

# Email fields
## Subject of the email -- pattern
## Plain text body
# Memo notes field -- is this special notes?

Follow-up
# Do we send separate emails per region contact, or the same email to all contacts across all regions
Answer: Send 1 email and cc all Regions from the WO
# Are the emails sent every time the WO is saved/scheduled -- or is it only upon validation of the entire work order?

fields.description:
Assumptions
# The user has selected the create a new item button as described in NES-1041
# The new item screen will operate the same as the following stories NES-1068, NES-1072, NES-1075, NES-1080, NES-1085, and NES-1086, besides what is listed below

Acceptance Criteria
# All fields will be empty or set to their default state (See attachment)
# Cancel button
## When clicked, will return the user to the previous queue they were in as described in NES-1041, or NES-1043
# Save
## Saves the item as a partial item in and creates a record in the processing queue
## If the item was set to active when saved, it will also create an item in the all items queue
# Create new item button
## When clicked, if all required fields(listed below) are filled out, the item will be added to the all items queue

*+Required Fields+*
* Vendor
* Item Number
* Item Description
* Department
* KS Item (no default value.  User MUST select either Yes or No)
* Item Delivery
* Serving Size
* Supply Charge (Y/N)
* Supply Type
* Method of Cooking
* Service Tags (at least 1 Tag is required per Item)
* Allergens (no default value.  User MUST select No or multi select allergens)
* Peanut Allergy (Y/N)
* Preparation Instructions
* Selling Points
* Safety Statement
